main event: A teacher and a student reported observing an unusual object with a reddish-orange glow near Hayesville, Louisiana on September 19, 1966.
interesting points: The object was shaped like a quarter moon and estimated to be about 300 feet wide and 150 feet long.,The observation took place at approximately 9:30 P.M.,The object appeared to move behind the trees before disappearing from view.,The report was addressed to the Commanding Officer of Barksdale Air Force Base.,The author of the report believes the sighting is worthy of investigation.
sighted object: an unusual object with a reddish-orange glow
witness description: a teacher and a student conducting routine activity
